reviews.review_msg: Do NOT take this if you don't need it. This is a 100 level course... I'm at the end of my 2nd year & this is the most demanding course I've ever taken. Several long and difficult readings every week. Long and boring lectures. Quizzes weekly. Essay instructions was literally 3 sentences. Not enough time to write exams (short answer and 2 essays)

Intro history class involved plenty of reading but that's pretty normal. Prof Taylor is a really nice guy who knows his content inside out. Personally, listening to him talk is absolutely fascinating, real mental stimulation. Tutorials were sort of a waste of time content wise, but we did get a lot of useful exam hints.

No laptops allowed, no lecture slides besides pictures and graphs (which if its your first history class be ready to be lost), overall he just talks a lot and very fast. I find it very hard to take proper notes, not worth it for the hum credit.

There were quizzes every class (INCLUDING THE FIRST CLASS). lectures are boring as he just talks with NO words on the slides at all, just pics!! Took this for my Hum credits, and wouldn't recommend with this specific prof. had to print 50 pages of readings each week for the daily quizzes and exams. made me want to kms every morning before class

The course had 3 papers that were marked by our TA, and we received feedback in a timely manner so we could apply corrections to the next paper. The final was a written/in-class essay marked by Tina. She is super kind and considerate, providing a reasonable amount of homework and time in some tutorials to complete work

Taking this 100 level class as a second year student, and felt it was more like a 400 level regarding the difficult marking, extensive essay prompts in little word counts and final exam set up. TA and Tina contradicted criteria and gave out key information after assignments were graded, and weren't open to discussion about grade changes.

Tina honestly seemed nice but honestly the course put a really sour taste in my mouth. The syllabus changed throughout the course (Tardy marks, grading weights, etc). The TA seemed to have a specific answer in mind for each assignment and wasn't open to other interpretations. Also was told "no one would receive above a B-". NOT A GPA BOOSTER

A great professor who gave interesting lectures, welcomed questions and gave good feedback. Tim also had comprehensive reviews before each exam which explained what he was looking for. He was also open to slightly changing exam formats based on how students did on previous tests.

One of my my favourite profs I have had at SFU. Lectures were really interesting and it was clear he cared about communicating with students and keeping the class engaging. Contrary to the other reviews here his exams felt really fair and if you read the material and go to lectures there should be no problem. Super interesting class and great prof

1rating bc you cant give 0. Most stressful course. Seriously, how is this a first lev class? There are better breadth-courses out there don't take any classes by him. Talks fast cant keep up, lecture slides only include photos so you need to attend. the exams were SO difficult and his marking is hard as well. I was legit failing at one point
